articles.title: UPDATE 2-Australia's Lake Resources teams up with clean tech firm Lilac to develop Argentina lithium project
articles.description: Australian lithium company Lake Resources NL and California-based Lilac Solutions said on Wednesday they are teaming up to jointly develop the Kachi Lithium Brine project in Argentina, sending Lake's shares rocketing more than 20% higher.
articles.content:
(Adds Lilac CEO comment, share price move)

articles.title: Brazil and Argentina tapped to make mRNA Covid-19 vaccines in Latin America
articles.description: A similar effort in Africa to develop vaccine production replicating Moderna's shot has been slowed by talks with the US company.. Read more at straitstimes.com.

articles.title: Brazil And Argentina Tapped To Make MRNA Vaccines In Latin America
articles.description: BRASILIA: The Pan American Health Organization (PAHO) has selected two biomedical centers in Argentina and Brazil as regional hubs to develop and produce mRNA-based vaccines to fight COVID-19 in Latin America, the regional health agency said on Tuesday.

articles.title: Brazil and Argentina tapped to make mRNA vaccines in Latin America
articles.description: Sinergium Biotech, a private sector biopharmaceutical company, was selected as the center in Argentina and will partner with pharmaceutical lab mAbxience of the same group to develop and manufacture active vaccine ingredients. The Americas branch of the World Health Organization said vaccine manufacture should benefit the entire region, with distribution funded by PAHO's Revolving Fund.
articles.content: The Pan American Health Organization (PAHO) has selected two biomedical centers in Argentina and Brazil as regional hubs to develop and produce mRNA-based vaccines to fight COVID-19 in Latin America, the regional health agency said on Tuesday. The id... [1721 chars]

articles.title: Argentina to lift almost all Covid restrictions as cases and deaths fall
articles.description: Masks will no longer be required outdoors as government says country could be at ‘end of pandemic’
articles.content:
Masks will no longer be required outdoors in Argentina as the country’s government announced the lifting of almost all Covid restrictions following a dramatic fall in Covid cases and deaths in recent months.

articles.title: UPDATE 2-Argentina economy jumps 17.9% in Q2, rebounding from pandemic
articles.description: Argentina's economy jumped 17.9% year on year in the second quarter, ahead of a median forecast, rebounding strongly after a sharp contraction in the same period of 2020 when the economy was hammered by the COVID-19 pandemic.
articles.content:
(Rewrites with official data)
BUENOS AIRES, Sept 21 (Reuters) - Argentina’s economy jumped 17.9% year on year in the second quarter, ahead of a median forecast, rebounding strongly after a sharp contraction in the same period of 2020 when the economy... [1230 chars]

articles.title: Argentina's 2020/21 soybean sales hit 30 mln tonnes -ministry
articles.description: BUENOS AIRES, Sept 21 (Reuters) - Argentine farmers have sold a total 30 million tonnes of soybeans from the 2020/21 crop, after registering sales over a seven-day period of 650,200 tonnes, the Ministry of Agriculture said on Tuesday.The sales volume of one of Argentina's main crops lagged that of the previous season, when by the equivalent point some 31.6 million tonnes of
articles.content:
BUENOS AIRES, Sept 21 (Reuters) - Argentine farmers have sold a total 30 million tonnes of soybeans from the 2020/21 crop, after registering sales over a seven-day period of 650,200 tonnes, the Ministry of Agriculture said on Tuesday.
